title: West Virginia study details promising method for estimating rural intravenous drug use

title_detail.value: West Virginia study details promising method for estimating rural intravenous drug use

summary: A study estimates that 1,857 people injected drugs in the last six months in Cabell County, W.Va., a rural county with a population of 94,958. This estimate is based on an innovative survey technique that public health officials can now use in their own rural communities to address the opioid epidemic.
